original: Bergquist, Karl Elof Salomon, civilingenjör SVR, vägingenjör, Kalmar, f. 10/6/06 i Fliseryd, Kalmar 1., av arb :chef Johan Elof B. o. Johanna Charlotta Nilson. G. 32 m. Greta Anderson. Barn: Birgitta f. 33, Jarl 37. — Stud:ex. v. norra real 26, KTH (V) 32, res:off:ex. 40. Löjtn. VVK 41, kapt. dito 46. Res. t. Tyskl., Holl., Belg. o. Frankr. 31. Anst. h. aukt. vägförrättn imannen John Nordenmark 32-33, h. Asplunds Ingibyrå i Gbg 33-38, egen konsult, verks. s. vägförrättn :man i vägar o. broar samt konsult i husbyggnad 38-44, väging. v. vägförvaltn. i Kalmar 1. sed. 44. Led. av sityr. f. Griainiit o. Beton A-B sed. 38, v. klubbmäst. i Kalmar teknologkl. sed. 46. Livscout 23, Sv:es scoutförb. förtj :med. 27.
translated: Bergquist, Karl Elof Salomon, engineer SVR, road engineer, Kalmar, b. June 10, 1906 in Fliseryd, Kalmar 1., son of work manager Johan Elof B. and Johanna Charlotta Nilson. Married in 1932 to Greta Anderson, with whom he had two children: Birgitta, born in 1933 and Jarl, born in 1937. He completed his studentexamen at Norra Real in 1926, KTH (V) in 1932, and his reservofficersexamen in 1940. He became a lieutenant of the VVK in 1941 and captain in 1946. He also worked as a road and bridge consultant, and consulting on building construction. He was appointed as a road engineer for the road management in Kalmar 1. in 1944. He was a member of the board of directors for Griainiit and Beton A-B since 1938 and was the club master for Kalmar Teknologklubb from 1946. He received a life scout award in 1923 and a merit medal from the Swedish Scout Association in 1927.
